settings.title: HER RESIDENCY INSPIRATION:
settings.text_center: Escapism through beauty is one meditative way to find the silver lining of staying still at home, so Shahzada searched high and low for a way to translate one of her favorite avant-garde beauty looks to one well-suited for a post-COVID cocktail party. "I've seen other artists create foil lips with actual foil for runway shows and it looks amazing," Shahzada says, noting that, while beautiful, the technique is impractical for everyday and difficult to convey the ombré finish she envisioned. "I had to really search for the right product that dries and still really looks like foil." Using a painting from artist Katie Rodgers as her guide—a striking melt of colors and tones—she successfully crafted her vision for her final week in residency.

settings.title: BEHIND THIS LOOK:
settings.desc: After prepping DiDonato’s face with the same complexion protocol as her first look, Shahzada warmed up the model’s cheeks with Chanel Powder Blush in In Love and defined her brows with Maybelline Fast Sculpting Brow Gel. “Her eyes were pretty much bare for this one,” Shahzada says, noting a subtle nod to her ‘silver lining’ theme on the model’s lashline thanks to Maybelline Color Tattoo Cream Eyeshadow Pot in Chill Girl.

settings.text_center:
After gently exfoliating DiDonato’s lips with a textured makeup-removing wipe, Shahzada reached for the pièce de résistance: Danessa Myricks Colorfix Foils in Rocket, Milky Way, Nebula, Venus, and Alien. “I added small amounts of each color onto a palette and then used Rēphr Brush #03 to pick up drops of color and apply them to different parts of her lips,” the artist explains. “Then I took a clean blending brush to buff them together.”

Pro tip: “The product dries very fast and doesn’t move, which is a good thing,” she says, but notes that it’s crucial to move quickly. “Make it your own—that’s what makes it original!”

settings.title: FEBRUARY ARTIST IN RESIDENCE: SIR JOHN
settings.text_center: WELCOME TO ARTIST IN RESIDENCY, OUR NEW SERIES THAT BRINGS THE INDUSTRY'S MOST INNOVATIVE MAKEUP ARTISTS TO ROSE INC. FOR A MONTH OF CREATIVITY AND INSPIRATION. EACH WEEK, YOU'LL DISCOVER AN ORIGINAL LOOK—AND THE STORY BEHIND IT—CREATED BY AN ARTIST WE LOVE.

settings.quotes: ‘‘ MAKE IT YOUR OWN—THAT’S WHAT MAKES IT ORIGINAL!  ’’

settings.text_center: Emily Didonato photographed by Elias Tahan. Makeup by Misha Shahzada. Hair by Clara Leonard using Hair by Sam McKnight. Styled by Lottie Elisa. Written by Lexy Lebsack.
